intro: Peucedanum friesiorum var. bipinnatum, commonly known as the bipinnate cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbrella-shaped inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features finely divided, bipinnate leaves that give it a delicate, feathery appearance. Its white flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in moist meadows and woodland edges, thriving in partial shade to full sun.
